chunks.raw_text: The north north west service territory (NNWST) covers seven (7) districts in northern Uganda which include; Amuru, Gulu, Kole, Oyam, Adjumani, Moyo, Anaka, Pader. To effectively coordinate operations in the territory, UEDCL has established four (7 fully-fledged support offices at Gulu, Otwal, Adjumani, Kamdini, Pabbo, Anaka & Moyo. The respective contact offices together with local leadership handle a myriad of customer-related needs including; electric faults/reports, connections, tokens, and safety. All these principles are geared to ensuring power availability and reliability which directly feeds into socio-economic development. The CNST has a customer base of 8102 in following strata’s; The territory operations are coordinated by a territory manager (TM), assisted by managers, assistant managers, technical assistants, linesmen, assistant linesmen, office administrators, and a regional customer care officer. UEDCL is also at the forefront of implementing the government of Uganda programme on free electricity connection policy (ECP) aimed at increasing access to electricity in rural areas. Cost: Free service Contact: +256703136424

chunks.raw_text: The Uganda Electricity Distribution Company Limited (UEDCL) hereby informs its esteemed customers of the following Electricity Retail Tariff rates applicable for the period of October to December 2025 as approved by the Electricity Regulatory Authority (ERA) as below: 1.The schedule of electricity end user retail tariffs shall be applicable to all consumer bills raised based on meter readings taken from October to December 2025 for customers on post- paid billing system. For customers on prepaid system (Light), the rates shall apply to electricity purchases made. 2.The lifeline tariff applies to only domestic customers whose consumption does not exceed 100 units per month based on the six months moving average, with the first 15 units charged at a lifeline tariff of UGX 250 per kWh. Pricing: 5.The pegged to demand tariff shall only be applicable to Extra-large industrial customers. | The Uganda Electricity Distribution Company Limited (UEDCL) hereby informs its esteemed customers of the following Electricity Retail Tariff rates applicable for the period of October to December 2025 as approved by the Electricity Regulatory Authority (ERA) as below: | 4.The Authority has ceased implementation of the declining block tariff for Extra-large industries except for Large Industrial Consumers. The thresholds shall be communicated to the respective consumers by UEDCL. | 6.The Electricity Regulatory Authority introduced a new set of tariffs for customers engaged in manufacturing and provision of service. These new categories of consumers are under Medium Industrial Consumers and Large Industrial consumers. | Electricity End User Tariffs... | 2.The lifeline tariff applies to only domestic customers whose consumption does not exceed 100 units per month based on the six months moving average, with the first 15 units charged at a lifeline tariff of UGX 250 per kWh. | 1.The schedule of electricity end user retail tariffs shall be applicable to all consumer bills raised based on meter readings taken from October to December 2025 for customers on post- paid billing system. For customers on prepaid system (Light), the rates shall apply to electricity purchases made. | 3.Other charges such as fixed monthly charges, maximum demand charges, inspection fees, new connection charges, reconnection fees and penalties for power theft remain unchanged. Cost: UGX 250 | Free service Contact: Toll Free: 0800203088 | 0800203088

chunks.raw_text: 1. Get a wireman (Power Kapo) certified by ERA to do for you house wiring and upon completion, he/she will issue you with two documents. 2. Present these documents to any of the UEDCL office/s in your locality upon which you will be given application form to fill. While returning the filled in application form, you will come along with; Pricing: 3. You'll then be required to pay Inspection and Initial energy fees via Mobile money or bank depending on how you'll be advised from our office. chunks.raw_text: Q: HOW DO I GET AN ELECTRICITY CONNECTION? A: 1. Get a wireman (Power Kapo) certified by ERA to do for you house wiring and upon completion, he/she will issue you with two documents. i) A wiring certificate and ii) a photocopy of his permit. 2. Present these documents to any of the UEDCL office/s in your locality upon which you will be given application form to fill. While returning the filled in application form, you will come along with; i) 2 passport size coloured photos ii) Recommendation letter from LC1 chairperson iii) Document confirming property ownership I. E land title, a letter from landlord in case it's the tenant applying. iv) Identification documents i. e photocopy of National ID or Driving permit v) A map showing where the site is. 3. You'll then be required to pay Inspection and Initial energy fees via Mobile money or bank depending on how you'll be advised from our office. (The fees may vary depending on the phase a customer is interested in). 4. Our technical surveyor will then visit your site/ premises t to cross-check the standard of wiring. 5.Upon passing the survey, a meter will be allocated to the customer and will later be taken to site for connection.
chunks.cleaned_text: Q: HOW DO I GET AN ELECTRICITY CONNECTION? A: 1. Get a wireman (Power Kapo) certified by ERA to do for you house wiring and upon completion, he/she will issue you with two documents. i) A wiring certificate and ii) a photocopy of his permit. 2. Present these documents to any of the UEDCL office/s in your locality upon which you will be given application form to fill. While returning the filled in application form, you will come along with; i) 2 passport size coloured photos ii) Recommendation letter from LC1 chairperson iii) Document confirming property ownership I. E land title, a letter from landlord in case it's the tenant applying. iv) Identification documents i. e photocopy of National ID or Driving permit v) A map showing where the site is. 3. You'll then be required to pay Inspection and Initial energy fees via Mobile money or bank depending on how you'll be advised from our office. (The fees may vary depending on the phase a customer is interested in). 4. Our technical surveyor will then visit your site/ premises t to cross-check the standard of wiring. 5.Upon passing the survey, a meter will be allocated to the customer and will later be taken to site for connection.
headings: HOW DO I GET AN ELECTRICITY CONNECTION?

chunks.raw_text: Q: HOW DO I RETRIEVE MY TOKEN? A: Tokens also form the biggest chunk of complaints raised by the customers who consume our energy. This is caused by a number of technical factors, but most common, is network fluctuation from the telecom service providers. For those customers vending from MTN network, you as a customer can serve yourself by following the procedure below; Dial *165# and press okay/yes Select option 4: Payments Select option 1: Utilities Select Option 2: UEDCL Under Option 2: Get UEDCL last token and the story is closed. Those vending on Airtel, the modus for customer self-help is not yet available. So we encourage you to call our toll free customer call centre number at 0800203088. You can also find us on social media @UEDCLTD Twitter & @UEDCLTD on Facebook/Messenger and ask for expeditious help.

Those vending on Airtel, the modus for customer self-help is not yet available. So we encourage you to call our toll free customer call centre number at 0800203088. You can also find us on social media @UEDCLTD Twitter & @UEDCLTD on Facebook/Messenger and ask for expeditious help.
headings: HOW DO I RETRIEVE MY TOKEN?

chunks.raw_text: Q: WHO DETERMINES THE ELECTRICITY TARIFF? A: This is one of the most customer featured questions from all UEDCL communication channels. The responsibility of setting the end user tariff is not of UEDCL nor any other electricity distributor in the country. This function is executed by the Electricity Regulatory Authority (ERA) in accordance to the 1999 electricity act and does so every quarter in a year. This means, three tariff schedules are issued by ERA every year and are effectively implemented by UEDCL to its customers. Further details about electricity tariffs can be obtained from www.era.go.ug.
